The parameter 'Service Options / STP / Disable enforced check of portfolio group/portfolio being processed' has been changed to a drop down with three options 'Disabled', 'Status services' and 'All services'. The default is 'Status services' where the system "only" check if another status service is currently processing the portfolio group/portfolio. If selecting 'All' it's all services, including match and communication server.

1) If both transaction code sets are identical, with one or more passive transaction selected, then the active passive code set should return a non-empty list.
2) Transactions should always be loaded for a portfolio if ActivePassiveDetermination using Transaction code sets is enabled in Branch Configuration.
3) Active trades should also be detected on rules without grouping ( affects both ActivePassiveDetermination using Transaction code sets and OnlyFailOnActiveTrade logic. )
4) If ActivePassiveDetermination using Transaction code sets is enabled, always update active/passive determination on each validation, so long as the alert's current active / passive status is not Active.
When trading bonds quoted on margin an actual trading margin was calculated which slightly differed from the entered quote. The error has been corrected.
The 'Transaction Option' in tab 'Fields' - 'Fields in additional data' now works for transactions created and/or modified in 'General Exchange' window.

"Calc. Accr. Interest" and “"Calc. Accr. Interest ex coupon" are properly populated on Lots when: 'Accrued interest dissolution principle' is 'Immediate', 'Accrued interest per tax lot' is Yes, “Calculate EOP accrued interest on settled position" is On or Off, Default booking date is Agreement and Settlement, and we are creating Accrued Interest or Tax Lot Combined Adjustment transactions, in the middle of a flow that includes unsettled decrementing transactions.
When reconnecting to server we should not ignore the result from TryReconnect. This correction is preventing a crash when innerclient is null, because of reconnect.

Introducing the ability to create a SCD user from C# on the basis of the authorized principal name and the Claims from an Oauth2 JWT bearer token.

This will only be relevant in case it is impossible to lookup the user in the scd installation by the principal name.

If a the user is marked inactive, the authorisation will fail and we will not create a user.

To successfully create a Scd User in the login flow it requires that in the AAD of an azure subscription,

The user must have defined some auth roles where the role names start with a prefix, e.g. "Prod" followed by the name of a normal user role expected to be defined in the Scd installation.
In the scd installation apart from the roles must exist, the below parameters must be set, e.g.:

UserLogonLDAP_Installed=1 (ins.ini)
LdapPrefix=Prod (cnf.ini)
useosaut=dAUTHTYPE int value (cnf.ini)

It was not possible to transport the 'PME index' information in the 'Calculation engine setup\Benchmarking' configuration window using the 'Configuration Transport -System options' window. Even if the ‘Always return error level if job fails’ was checked, the batch job group returned ‘Executed’ instead of ‘Failed’ if one or more batch jobs within the batch job group failed. This has been corrected.
For batch task 'Specific Function - Batch Execution' the possibility of using 'Target line' has been removed, as it was a security risk.

The Validate Market Data Using Service Platform window's initialization functionality attempt to acquire exclusive database lock on the Market Data Validation Queue (MKTDATAVALQUEUE) table.
Previously it did so with a no wait statement and then waited for 6 seconds before trying again. Now it will attempt to acquire the exclusive lock for 6 seconds, and then wait for another 6 seconds before trying again.
This should make it more likely to acquire the exclusive database lock.

When importing external forecasts via 'Import\Retrieve External Forecast'  it will now be possible to activate the single log viewer by pressing the Log button next to the 'Import' button in the external 'Alternative Investments Manager' ribbon section.

The validation for a valid QP FX rates were skipped for open/close commitment transactions using group currency accounting values leading to a crash when trying to save the transaction as the group currency accounting values were missing. The validation has now been enabled.

Configuration Service now support 'PRICEQUALITIES'.
IMS tracing have been added to all configuration services calls in the APL code, meaning it's now possible to trace what methods and their parameters are called.

It is now possible to 'Filter' the list of users. It's possible to filter using: User, User name, Net ID and Machine ID. Furthermore the form has been changed to a normal form, meaning it can stay open when other forms are used. And finally the form now got a automatic update, meaning the list of users are refreshed automatically.

When saving a Securities Lending Maturity' 'MatReverse' transaction having 'Actual Settlement' data wrongly the error message 'Underlying holdings cannot be found. Try modifying the transaction instead.'  could appear. This has been fixed.
When the transactions for Bonds are created in Dealer Window the value in Yield is calculated differently after the user removes it. This was corrected.

Actual Settlement data update now suported correct for security lending transactions and its booking. This all making it possible to use NOMINALACT framework to ensure collateral return in sync with actual return of security lended before and covered with the collateral.
There was a crash while fetching position in Coupons screen for bonds with Interest type Multiple. That is fixed now

Selecting the "Paydown and forecast transactions" and/or  "Loan and forecasted transactions" check boxes no longer excluded forecasted transactions in the Cash Viewer applet of the Asset Manager.
